intro: Amerimnon secundum, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its unique, zigzagging stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
